ClearMetal helps people get the things they need by using data science to solve the most complex operational problems in supply chain. The world’s largest brands trust ClearMetal’s SaaS platform to drive efficiency and eliminate waste in their global logistics & international freight transportation. We’re founded by ex-Google, Stanford MBAs & Engineers, and venture-backed by NEA, SAP, Eric Schmidt’s Innovation Endeavors, Eclipse VC, and Prelude Ventures. If you want to solve massive, real-world problems with the best technology and smartest people, come work with us!We are looking for a Data Science Analyst to join the Data Science team. The Data Science team builds ML/AI applications and services that help businesses understand, manage, and optimize their supply chain. This is a high visibility, fast-paced environment that will leverage your excellent communication skills, data engineering, analytics skills, and ability to work in a team environment. Working closely with PMs, data engineers, and data scientists, the analyst will have the opportunity to provide meaningful insights that are directly reflected in product and business decisions. A successful candidate will be technically proficient, have the ability to clearly synthesize and communicate information, and brings a can-do attitude. This is a tremendous opportunity for someone who wants to grow and eventually transition into a Data Science/ML Engineer role.What You'll DoPartner with Engineering, Customer Success, and Product leads to define business objectives (KPIs) and build dashboards that support ongoing reporting and analysis of results against those objectivesUnderstand the fundamentals of ML models, and perform analysis to provide insights for model improvementBuild data pipelines to prepare aggregated results for dashboardsCreate analysis reports and dashboardsWork cross-functionally to identify, report, and fix data quality issues using sustainable and best-practice tools and processesWork with Data Architects on improving data sources by implementing standardized calculations and variablesPerform analyses and develop metrics to be displayed in ClearMetal productsEnsure the integrity of data within the systemWhat You'll Need3+ years of professional experience as an analyst, preferably at an early stage high growth companyExperience with big data techniques and querying tools a plusWorking experience with machine learning and predictive modelingExperience and ability to collect and integrate multiple data sourcesProficiency in querying, manipulating, and analysis of datasets using SQL and SQL-like languagesExperience with Python, data visualization, and dashboarding tools and librariesKnowledge of the fundamentals of probability, statistics, machine learning, and predictive analyticsAbility to tell stories with data: possess strong communication skills, and the ability to take complex problems and explain them simply to technical and non-technical peersAbility to think creatively and apply analytical, design, and problem-solving capabilities to solve engineering and business problemsA constant desire to learn and improveDegree in Data Science, Engineering, Math, or related fieldClearMetal is committed working with people from all backgrounds; we are a proud equal opportunity employer.

PRODUCT MANAGER FOR RELIABILITY ENGINEERINGHouston, Texas, United States Product Manager for Reliability Engineering  Our Firm is a different kind of investment manager. Since 2001, we have used data science and technology to derive insights that forecast the future and discover value in markets worldwide. Our team of scientists, technologists and academics looks beyond traditional finance to understand the bigger picture and develop creative solutions to some of the world’s most difficult economic problems. Our work spans markets and industries, from insurance and securities to private investments and new ventures. We are seeking a deeply technical Product Manager to join the Reliability Engineering Team at our firm.  You will be responsible for crafting the strategy and building products for improving the observability, reliability, scalability, and supportability for services and applications developed at our company. You will take on the following responsibilities: Develop a strategic product view of external and internal developments in the DevOps and Reliability Engineering space Fully understand the customer needs for Reliability Engineering Products at our company with an eye for anticipating customer needs and creating platform effects Be the advocate for the user when working with engineering throughout the product development cycle from vision to execution Use metrics and quantitative analysis to measure product benefits, gain insights, find opportunities, and build consensus on product direction and roadmap Evangelize and drive adoption of Reliability Engineering Products and DevOps best practices across our firm You should possess the following qualifications: BA/BS in Computer Science, related technical field or commensurate experience 5+ years developing highly successful technology products with previous experience building platform and infrastructure  products a plus Demonstrated customer focus Real passion for designing simple solutions to complex problems Clear bias for action, with a collaborative, no-ego approach Extraordinary analytical and interpersonal skills Ability to communicate with simplicity, precision, and empathy   While we build products in the financial space, financial experience is not a requirement You will enjoy the following benefits: Core Benefits: Fully paid medical and dental insurance premiums for employees and dependents, competitive 401k match, employer-paid life & disability insurance Perks: Onsite gyms with laundry service, wellness activities, casual dress, snacks, game rooms  Learning: Tuition reimbursement, conference and training sponsorship Time Off: Generous vacation and unlimited sick days, competitive paid caregiver leaves

DescriptionAs part of a small, passionate and accomplished team of experts, you will lead efforts to identify, capture, develop, and demonstrate technologies in the area of machine learning and data science to support Blue Origin’s vision of enabling a future where millions of people are living and working in space. You will lead small and multi-disciplinary teams to identify, prioritize, and execute industry-shaping technology projects across the product lifecycle while working with internal and external customers and partners.You will help develop a long range technology and innovation roadmap, ensure your efforts support the company vision, and incorporate or evolve projects into major development programs as needed. You should be adept at managing to a plan and a budget in a small team, comfortable adjusting it in response to evolving requirements or external constraints, and prioritizing technology investment all the while infusing and facilitating creativity and innovation. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your dedicated commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable human spaceflight.While in this role, you will leverage your extensive experience in machine learning and data science to accelerate and innovate across business areas to drive improvements in the way we design, build, and operate our vehicles, launch systems, and business. The ideal candidate will have direct experience in the applied development and implementation of machine learning and deep learning techniques, artificial intelligence, operational research, semantic analysis, statistical methods or other advanced processing techniques.ResponsibilitiesDefine and manage a portfolio of technologies including capture, execution and infusion into major development programsPrepare and manage design/technology reviewsDevelop strategic plans and technology roadmaps to meet internal and external customer needs in the areas of machine learning and data scienceProject engineering, including tracking, reporting, and communication of status as well as definition and management of technical tasks, critical path items, and risks/opportunitiesDevelop project plans, budgets, and schedules, both from internally derived goals and constraints and from customer contracts and statements-of-workIdentify staffing needs and resources prioritiesBudget management and trackingDefine and capture new Research & Development (R&D) business, including supporting proposals to the U.S. Government Support the business development activities to tailor capabilities to meet emerging needsParticipate in conferences and customer meetings as a representative of Blue OriginEstablish, coordinate, and mature academic and research partnershipsQualifications: Minimum of a M.S. degree Electrical or Aerospace Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Physical Sciences or related technical field  15+ years industry experience, 5+ in progressive project management roles  Demonstrated technical expertise in machine learning techniques, probabilistic reasoning, adaptive control, data science, and/or optimization  Scientific thinking and the ability to invent, a track record of thought leadership and contributions that have advanced the field  Demonstrated ability to perform both theoretical (e.g., modeling, simulation, analysis, design) and applied (implementation, testing, and validation) development of advanced algorithms and data processing techniques  Demonstrated experience leading and managing small teams on fast-paced projects  Demonstrated software development experience  Leadership and management experience as well as a history of mentoring  Project management skills  Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Must be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum Desired:Ph.D. in Electrical or Aerospace Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or related technical fieldExperience across multiple portions of the product life cycle (concept definition through operations and use)Familiarity with applying machine learning techniques to real-time, safety-critical systemsSpecific experience leading Research & Development (R&D) projectsExperience with proposal leadership or support (technical/management volumes, basis-of-estimate development, etc.) Experience working with and proposing to U.S. Government research agencies (e.g. NASA, AFRL, DARPA) Experience with human spaceflightFamiliarity with autonomous systems, business intelligence, or generative designExperience developing requirements, defining subsystem interfaces (both in-house and between external partners/suppliers), and other systems engineering products and practicesAbility to obtain and retain a security clearanceBWKS Blue Origin offers a phenomenal work environment and awesome culture with competitive compensation, benefits, 401K, and relocation.Blue Origin is an  equal opportunity employer  . In addition to EEO being the law, it is a policy that is fully consistent with Blue's principles. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy or age. Blue Origin prohibits any form of workplace harassment.

Worker Sub-TypeStudent (Fixed Term)Job DescriptionTHE POSITIONCylance is seeking Data Science interns who will work with machine learning at the heart of its products during the Summer of 2019. Prior experience in security is a plus, but not necessary; the right candidate will be able to gain domain expertise during the internship, surrounded by some of the computer security industry’s leading minds.At Cylance, we develop state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to solve long-standing problems in computer security. We discover novel ML techniques and applications, build systems to handle petabytes of ludicrously high dimensional data, and protect people from bad guys. We protect millions of computers from security threats, and as an intern here, you’ll do real, meaningful research. Previous interns have seen their work directly impact our products, have published papers based on their research at Cylance, or have been inventor on a patent application related to their work.The Data Science team is a critical, highly visible, and high-impact team within the company. The team brings together experts from machine learning, stats, computer science, computer security, and various applied sciences, with backgrounds including deep learning, Bayesian statistics, time-series modeling, topology, scalable data processing, and software engineering.What You Will DoApply, improve, and invent machine learning techniques to solve important problems in computer securityWrite maintainable, readable code for running experiments and proofs-of-conceptsWork with very large datasets, often with millions of dimensionsCollaborate closely with other data scientists and security expertsWho We Are Looking ForCurrent PhD and Master’s students studying machine learning, statistics, or related fields; PhD students are strongly preferredStrong math skills in general, especially linear algebra and statisticsExperience with PythonExcellent communication skills, clearly conveying ideas to others in speech and in writingKindness, and a deep willingness to help and collaborate with othersABOVE AND BEYONDIndustry experienceExperience working with the following:Python, and libraries like sklearn, numpy, scipy, pytorch, and tensorflow.Various other languages, including Scala, C/C++, C#, Java, and x86 assembly.GitSparkVarious AWS services, like EC2 and S3What We Need From You To ApplyCurrent resumeCover letter/summary expressing:Why you are interested in working at CylanceThe skills, strengths and expertise you will contribute to our diverse team of extraordinary talent and humble heartsJob Family Group NameBusiness Practices & OperationsScheduled Weekly Hours40

Microsoft Research seeks research-oriented candidates in the areas of data science, software engineering, compilers/runtime, high-performance computing, and systems. We are seeking candidates who are interested in new approaches to improving the productivity, correctness and performance of machine learning pipelines at industrial scale. This is an exceptional opportunity to push the state-of-the-art research in the context of a diverse team of researchers, software engineers, and data scientists.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and contribute to an ambitious, high-impact, research agenda in improving the productivity, correctness, and performance of machine learning pipelinesCollaborate to develop and test out new ideas within existing or new collaborations within the group and with othersWrite code to test new approaches or develop novel practical insightsPrepare technical papers and presentationsQualificationsRequired Qualifications:PhD in data science, programming languages, compilers, software engineering, high-performance computing, machine learning, computer systems or a related areaPreferred QualificationsA research program demonstrated by journal and/or conference publicationsDeep understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning systems, compilers, and high-performance computingDemonstrable ability to work in a multi-disciplinary teamEffective communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative environmentMicrosoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Time Saver:  You must have 5+ years of recent strategic consulting experience working for a mid - large size IT consulting firm focused on C suite services to qualify for this role. (Slalom, Deloitte, Accenture are type examples).    Company is a growing high value management consulting firm to 75+ of the the most impactful F500 firms, servicing CIOs and teams from strategy and planning through execution and delivery.  Increasingly, clients they service are seeking to explore and optimize the business by embracing AI, ML and Data Science as a holistic solution. This role will be very client facing, working primarily CIO, CTO and other executive teams supporting enterprise wide initiatives.   As the Director, Data Science, the professional in this role will also be responsible for mentoring Data Engineers, Information Analysts and Information Architects, assisting junior consultants as they learn more about the tools, techniques and business outcomes that data science can enable. The ability to effectively manage talent and create an engaged, high-performing team environment is extremely important to achieving success in this role   The Director, Data Science will be required to reside in one of 6 cities and will travel based on client needs.   Qualified candidates will have:   A degree in computer science, MIS, mathematics or statistics. Strong verbal and written communication skills experienced with business case creation and proofs of concept. 5+ years of F500 C level facing professional services experience. Some experience with oral presentations and competitive positioning.  8+ years of progressive experience in data science methods and analytics consulting, or 15+ years of combined experience in data warehousing, data architecture and information management projects involving analytics. Demonstrated ability to deliver data science solutions for clients (end-to-end design and delivery of significant data science project work). Professional experience applying advanced analytics and data mining techniques to enable decision support systems and customer strategies. Proven data engineering or data visualization experience with large and/or complex data environments. Advanced understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests and Neural Networks. Experience with commonly used data science toolkits, such as Python, SAS, R, Weka, NumPy or MatLab. Experience working with data visualization tools, such as D3.js and GGplot. Proficient skills using query languages, such as MongoDB, Cassandra and HBase. Strong applied statistics skills. High intellectual curiosity with the desire to identify potential use cases for predictive analytics. Experience creating impactful models and algorithms for multiple functional areas (e.g., risk management, customer insights, real-time decision support, etc.). Expert understanding of industry trends for consumer insights analytics. Ability to understand and apply trends in research and analytics, and to apply learning, insights and recommendations to drive critical objectives.

The Data Science team is looking for an experienced leader to build and scale our Data Science organization. You’ll focus on multiple aspects of the business to help set the vision for what we build. You’ll define the roadmap, set metrics, improve the product, retention and quantify as well as surface opportunities for us to improve. You’ll also be able to build your own team with some of the best analytics and data science talent in the market, who want to tackle challenging technical problems in unique on-demand space.  The ideal candidate has experience leading analytics teams, working with complex data, building modern architectures, and data-driven decision making. You will be a great fit if you have previously led strong analytics teams and cultures, have created a vision for a data science architecture, and have demonstrated success business impact.  The role is based in New York.  Responsibilities: Recruit and lead a high-performing team of analysts and data scientists Work with your team to develop the models that drive the success of our business and the reporting infrastructure of the company Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business Partner with business and product leaders to improve our product and customer experience and prioritize projects for impact Represent the analytics team in key meetings and business reviews with our leadership team Help the team use data science methods to generate and test hypotheses, which include: performing analytical deep-dives to identify problems; opportunities and actions required; collecting, processing, cleaning, and storing data from disparate sources using SQL, R, Python, or other scripting and statistical tools; automate and improve the logistics of our business using model; manage the design, execution, and analysis of A/B or multivariate testing programs; drive a rigorous testing culture through across product and operations teams  Our Ideal Candidate: 8+ years of analytics / data science experience or equivalent; 4+ years of experience managing and scaling high growth analytics / data science teams Has managed an organization of 6 or more people, has experience managing managers Skilled at running cross-functional relationships and communicating with leadership across multiple organizations An ability to write very complex SQL queries. ETL experience a plus A deep understanding of statistical analysis (e.g. hypothesis testing, experimentation, regressions) and familiarity with statistical packages, such as R or Python Proficiency in one or more analytics & visualization tools (e.g. Chartio, Mode) Inspiring leader with a driven, results-focused attitude Strong analyst who is attentive to detail and sets a high bar for work produced by the team Ability to work in a dynamic, challenging environment where decisions you make will have a large impact Strategic problem solver who simplifies problems to their core elements and finds creative solutions Get-it-done mindset. You’re not afraid of long hours, able to handle stress well, humble and scrappy! B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in economics, applied math, statistics, physics, engineering or other quantitative fields

MissionSaturn Cloud helps companies perform data science at a new level of scale, with one-click solutions, to solve the world’s hardest problems. Our product is a SaaS platform which equips data science teams with high-leverage automation tools, eliminating hours of traditional, manual work. The platform is user-friendly, scalable and secure.You will be a Data Scientist (internship position) for Saturn Cloud, an exciting new venture founded by the creators of Anaconda, NumPy, and SciPy. The role is features participating in all product activities from inception to delivery, including engaging in discussion with Fortune 1000 customers to understand their needs, working with engineering to build insights, and coordinating with various internal stakeholders to ensure success.ResponsibilitiesWork on high-visibility projects (e.g. price optimization, content marketing, and demand forecasting)Participate in customer engagement, product definition, success metrics, prioritize features, to deliver a polished market-ready productConduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, and effectively communicate findings and provide key insights/recommendations to various functional leadsOwn cross-functional interactions for your features (across eng/marketing/field/sales)RequirementsDegree or currently pursuing degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Operations Research, Statistics, Economics)Proficient knowledge of R or Python, SQLComfortable with quantitative analysis, statistical techniques, data miningGood communicator (written & visual presentation)Strong interpersonal skills and ability to influence othersGreat team playerBenefitsCompetitive salary commensurate with your growing experienceOpportunity for stock options in early-stage venture poised for scaleMedical, dental, vision coverageAwesome coworkersAbout UsOur mission is to transform the businesses of our customers by making data science faster. Founded by the creators of Anaconda, NumPy and SciPy, Saturn provides a powerful data science platform for teams to build and manage data products. Our clients boast accelerated value creation cycles with Saturn by automating key elements of their analytics workflows and reaching new levels of productivity. We make data scientists happier and their businesses more successful. For more information, visit www.saturncloud.io

Entytle’s cloud-based software creates highly qualified opportunities for the aftermarket business, driving top-line growth, improved sales cycle time and predictable revenue. With Entytle, aftermarket sales teams have actionable and timely insights into customers’ needs and can close more sales in less time.How? Our Aftermarket Engagement Platform aggregates and enriches customer data, analyzes customer history and behavior using sophisticated machine learning and statistical analysis, and surfaces actionable customer insights to drive aftermarket revenue growth.Entytle is a 2016 Red Herring - North America Top 100 Company. The company has funding from Accel Partners, is based in Austin, TX and is hiring awesome, entrepreneurial employees to join the rapidly growing team.MissionLead the data science team in delivering innovative but pragmatic solutions to help our customers drive aftermarket salesOutcomesWork collaboratively with Entytle stakeholders to identify key questions that need to be addressed and then leverage the data science team to deliver required capabilitiesDesign, architect and deliver a well-structured data science platform for research and execution of data and analytics projectsCreate and maintain an efficient and effective Data Science TeamPosition DescriptionThe position reports to the VP of Analytics. You will lead the vision, design and development of Entytle’s data science solutions. You will work with other data scientists, engineers and product managers leading the development of innovative data science models (e.g. AI, ML) in support of our installed base sales automation application. Your communication skills will allow you to work closely with our manufacturing-based customers. You will use your agile experience to work with our geographically dispersed teams.ResponsibilitiesMeet with external customers and experts to understand business challenges and propose new modeling and algorithmic solutions that leverage the latest in statistical and machine learning techniques.Study data sources and find insights/correlation to investigate how data science can be used to solve existing and new business challenges.Apply statistical analysis and modeling techniques on small and large datasets to solve specific business problems in the installed base sales automation domain.Provide strategic leadership in selection of platform, tools, techniques and processes in the practice of Data Science discipline.Work collaboratively with your data science team, engineers, developers and product management to translate business requirements into technical requirements that can be addressed with statistical and machine learning techniques.Provide mentorship to other Data Scientists on your team.Own and drive contemporary best practices in applying and deploying data science at scale.CompetenciesStrong sense of and an ability to cultivate an environment of teamwork, and a willingness to help others.Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical staff members and customers.Proficiency in data analysis and programming languages such as SQL, Python, and R.4-8 years hands-on experience in machine learning, statistics or experiment design.Master’s Degree required (PhD would be a plus) in Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Physics or a related field with focus on data analysis.Expertise in machine learning, statistics, data analysis. Must have an excellent knowledge of advanced methods, and experience in applying those methods to a variety of problems.Solid grasp of probability, statistical or mathematical modeling with analytical and quantitative problem-solving ability. Experience with time-series analysis would be a plus.Demonstrated experience in applying machine learning to real-world problemsMust have delivered data science components as part of a commercial solution at scale.Familiarity with software development cycles, source control systems (including Git), databases, and cloud computing platforms such as AWS.Knowledge of large equipment manufacturing, installed base sales, recurring revenue, and equipment service would be a plus.

Organization Description AutoGrid?s mission is to organize the exponentially increasing amount of energy data produced from a networked and automated grid and make it useful and actionable for electricity generators and providers, grid operators, and electricity users. With deployments of smart meters, distributed generation, and other building and grid sensing technologies now reaching critical mass, all participants in the electricity supply chain find themselves having to process and analyze thousands of times more data than they?ve had before. Most organizations that produce or consume electricity have yet to take advantage of this information to improve their decision-making processes and lower their costs. AutoGrid enables Utilities, Electricity Service Providers, Grid Operators, DR Aggregators, and End-Users to precisely forecast, monitor and control power consumption securely and in real-time, maximizing the value of existing assets with Software Defined Power Plants. Job Description AutoGrid is seeking Data Science Interns for Summer 2018. We are a rapidly growing company with significant market traction and a large pipeline of diverse opportunities. As such the role will be dynamic and varied, requiring a versatile self-starter willing to dive in to multiple initiatives. Over 10 weeks the intern can expect to become deeply involved in implementing user features and analytics models that will run in production. Our goal is to give the intern exposure to a range of data science techniques and current big data technologies, through the experience of applying them to the energy industry. This role will provide an excellent opportunity to implement features that run in production, at scale. Qualifications Experience in one or more of the following: PythonStream processing frameworksSQLBig Data analyticsAlgorithms in machine learning and econometrics: eg. random forest, SVR, ARIMAExperience in energy and electric utilities is a plus

JMA is currently seeking a Data Scientist Intern to join the Business Analytics Team in our San Francisco office. Our team is tasked with absorbing millions of rows of data from various of sources, organizing them, visualizing them, and analyzing them to help inform decision-making and investment strategies. You will be tasked with transforming complex and not always structured data sets into actionable insight for our acquisitions team. We want you to use that intuition you’ve developed (both in business and real life) to use the data we have on hand to find opportunities for growth and to develop insights that help the organization meet its investment goals, improve its performance, and positively impact the bottom line in the real estate market.Once you’re here, you’ll help engineer, analyze, and report on data to improve and streamline the due diligence process. Your work will provide digestible insights for acquisition leaders and JMA executives.What You Will DoBuild price prediction models for property value growthBuild cost prediction models for real estate developmentCollaborate with acquisitions and asset management teams to integrate your model outputsAs an early member, help set the culture, processes and tools of the data science teamWhat We Are Looking ForEducation and Prior ExperienceBS/BA required. Enrolled in a graduate program of study as a full-time studentExperience through thesis research, internships, or work experience in a science, technology, engineering or mathematics (STEM) related field, such as:Computational social scienceComputer scienceData analyticsEconomicsEngineeringGeospatial analysisMathematicsOperations researchPhysicsQuantitative financeStatisticsPrevious experience in quantitative fields including predictive modeling, statistics, financeSome experience in real estate is preferred, but not necessaryTechnical SkillsStrong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skillsStrong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, database management, VBA, AWS, SQLStrong proficiency in R or PythonFamiliar with GIS software and location-based data setsPersonal SkillsAbility to think and act independently to assess and prioritize new opportunities and present findings to acquisition and senior management teamsDemonstrated ability to lead and complete predictive modeling and data science related projectsSelf-starter and strong work ethic with willingness to work in a demanding, highly focused, and collaborative environmentPragmatic and gets things doneRequired EducationMaster’s educationRequired ExperienceMachine Learning, Statistics, Predictive Modeling: 1 yearWho We AreJMA is a full-service investment and development firm focusing on real estate and leisure-lifestyle assets. We work on every project scope from concept and entitlement through completion and operation. Our portfolio includes landmark properties that span hospitality, resort, destination, residential, retail, office and commercial developments. We believe their success is founded on our team’s keen understanding of the user experience and a deep knowledge of trends, tastes and desires that drive the creation of truly unique places. As a company and as members of the communities we build in, we have a firm commitment to sustainability and a responsibility to better the neighborhoods we work in – both environmentally and economically.

Worker Sub-TypeStudent (Fixed Term)Job DescriptionTHE POSITIONCylance is seeking Data Science interns who will work with machine learning at the heart of its products during the Summer of 2019. Prior experience in security is a plus, but not necessary; the right candidate will be able to gain domain expertise during the internship, surrounded by some of the computer security industry’s leading minds.At Cylance, we develop state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to solve long-standing problems in computer security. We discover novel ML techniques and applications, build systems to handle petabytes of ludicrously high dimensional data, and protect people from bad guys. We protect millions of computers from security threats, and as an intern here, you’ll do real, meaningful research. Previous interns have seen their work directly impact our products, have published papers based on their research at Cylance, or have been inventor on a patent application related to their work.The Data Science team is a critical, highly visible, and high-impact team within the company. The team brings together experts from machine learning, stats, computer science, computer security, and various applied sciences, with backgrounds including deep learning, Bayesian statistics, time-series modeling, topology, scalable data processing, and software engineering.What You Will DoApply, improve, and invent machine learning techniques to solve important problems in computer securityWrite maintainable, readable code for running experiments and proofs-of-conceptsWork with very large datasets, often with millions of dimensionsCollaborate closely with other data scientists and security expertsWho We Are Looking ForCurrent PhD and Master’s students studying machine learning, statistics, or related fields; PhD students are strongly preferredStrong math skills in general, especially linear algebra and statisticsExperience with PythonExcellent communication skills, clearly conveying ideas to others in speech and in writingKindness, and a deep willingness to help and collaborate with othersABOVE AND BEYONDIndustry experienceExperience working with the following:Python, and libraries like sklearn, numpy, scipy, pytorch, and tensorflow.Various other languages, including Scala, C/C++, C#, Java, and x86 assembly.GitSparkVarious AWS services, like EC2 and S3What We Need From You To ApplyCurrent resumeCover letter/summary expressing:Why you are interested in working at CylanceThe skills, strengths and expertise you will contribute to our diverse team of extraordinary talent and humble heartsJob Family Group NameBusiness Practices & OperationsScheduled Weekly Hours40

Job DescriptionNovelis manufacturing processes produce the operational run-time data for each coil across 15+ machine centers in various plant throughout the globe. To standardize Machine Learning models across various plants, we plan to build a Data Science platform with common set of libraries of routines. We also plan to build a common library of features used in our models allowing faster go-to-market of the new models.The Data Science Intern will help develop routines using Object Oriented Python classes and methods. Key Learnings  The Data Science Intern will learn the existing models developed by the Digital group and will help standardize those using Pipelines.  The Data Science Intern will learn/understand the manufacturing process and understand common data manipulation tasks.  The Data Science Intern will understand software development lifecycle and work in a professional environment.  The Data Science Intern may help develop a library containing all the features currently engineered. Qualifications Either have completed Masters in Software Engineering/Data Science or currently enrolled in a program  A proficient understanding of Python based Object Oriented Programming  Experience with software and model engineering concepts such as versioning, model deployment and model retraining etc.  Hands on experience with such Python libraries as Scikit-Learn, Unittest and Pytest, Flask and MLFlow  Understanding of git workflow and CI/CD.  Experience in Collaborative and Iterative Development  Desire for continuous development and learning opportunities  Strong analytical, organizational, presentation, and time management skills Minimum Experience LevelReport toScientist

SummaryThe Data Science Specialist will be part of a data science or cross-disciplinary team on development projects, typically involving large, complex data sets. This team includes statisticians, computer scientists, software developers, engineers, product managers, technicians and end users, working in concert with partners in Makino business units. Potential application areas include collected data analysis and diagnostics across multiple metal cutting machine platforms.Essential Duties And Responsibilities Develop analytics within well-defined projects to address customer needs and opportunities. Work alongside software developers and software engineers to translate algorithms into commercially viable products and services. Contribute to technical discussions and reviews as an expert in related areas of responsibility. Maintain state-of-the-art knowledge in related areas of responsibility. Communicate ideas, plans and results effectively via presentations and written reports. Generate reports, annotated code, and other projects artifacts to document, archive, and communicate your work and outcomes. Work with data engineers on data quality assessment, data cleansing and data analytics. Work effectively with peers, management, operations groups, and outside organizations. Work in technical teams in development, deployment, and application of applied analytics, predictive analytics, and prescriptive analytics. Perform exploratory and targeted data analyses using descriptive statistics and other methods. Share and discuss findings with team members. Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The physical demands include travel, typing, writing, light lifting, etc. More than 40 hours per week is often required to effectively perform this job including infrequent weekend travel/working requirements.Work Environment: Most of the work will be in an office environment with occasional overnight travel to other Makino facilities or manufacturing environments containing Makino equipment. Overnight travel is expected to be less than 20%.Required SkillsEducation and/or Experience: Master’s Degree in Electrical, Mechanical, Mathematics, Aerospace Engineering or Computer Science with demonstrated research capability or equivalent experience. Demonstrated skill in the use of one or more analytic software tools or languages (e.g., SAS, SPSS, R, Python, Matlab)  Strong background in diagnosis, prognosis and control systems analysis and synthesis. Background/familiarity/experience with metal cutting technologies Experience with multiple statistical programming languages such as Python, R, SAS etc. Database query programs (SQL, Experience with Pivotal, Postgres) Experience with Github Basic understanding of statistics and predictive algorithms. Background in Multivariate Calculus and Machine Learning. Experience with Data visualization and communication. Domain knowledge in Compute, Database, Network, and Storage Experience in IT Service Management environments. Strong background in diagnosis, prognosis and fault-tolerant control systems analysis and synthesis. Strong background in system diagnosis and prognosis algorithms development and integration. Effective verbal and written communication skills. Excellent interpersonal skills to work effectively with Makino internal and external customers.

At Carta, we design products that transform the way hospitals use data to deliver care. We make analyzing data fast, easy, and useful for everyone. We're looking for Data Scientists skilled at rapid iteration and excited about solving problems that can save lives. This is a startup role, where we will ask you to wear many hats and solve many different types of problems.Best of all, when we say Data Science Internship, we mean Data Science internship--no grunt work, no code cleanup, no bug fixes. Like kaggle, you'll be solving incredibly interesting Data Science puzzles but, unlike kaggle, every puzzle you solve will measurably help save people's lives and save our healthcare system. We'll give you a unique experience to see how far you can push your Data Science skills that you won't be able to find anywhere else.You love solving complex engineering problems, by creating beautiful, and well-tested algorithms. You're a positive individual who leads by example, drives conceptual thinking, and brings a curiosity and experimental approach to solving engineering challenges. Position: Data Scientist Intern – March, 2019, Payformance Solutions (hourly position)  Office: Chicago, IL Why We’re Excited To Get To WorkThe mission for Payformance Solutions is simple. We aim to be a catalyst for payment transformation in the healthcare industry. Our proprietary software solutions allow payers and providers to focus on what really matters: providing patients with access to care that yields the best health outcomes, at the lowest costs.The healthcare industry is complex and fragmented. Payers and providers are faced with a lack of transparency and conflicting financial goals that fail to consider the health outcomes of patients. We help stakeholders plan, negotiate, operate and optimize value-based reimbursement programs by leveraging our industry-leading research and technology to develop alternative payment strategies. Our comprehensive, full-service approach ensures that your organization’s transition to value-based care accelerates smoothly with speed and flexibility while improving the quality of care.What We Are Looking ForOur team is currently looking for a data science intern to join our team. This position will help support our data analytics needs. As a data science intern, you will utilize a diverse array of technologies and tools as needed to deliver insights, such as Python, SQL, Jupyter, D3.js, and other related software. You will be a contributor to the team, tasked with developing analytics models and algorithm solutions.What You ’ Ll Do Assist with data / business analytics needs  Utilize a diverse array of technologies and tools to deliver insights: Python, R, Jupyter, Spark, Hadoop, and AWS Athena  Analyze and model structured data, and implement algorithms to support analysis using advanced statistical and mathematical methods from statistics, machine learning, data mining, econometrics, and operations research  Work with developers and engineers to spec out database models and determine implementation of algorithms  Model building and testing  Perform analysis using big data sources that provide insight and value  Assist in creating reports and provide timely analysis What You’ll Bring To The Table Currently enrolled in a Masters or PhD degree program from an accredited college/ university in quantitative fields (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Data Analytics, or related field)  Proficiency with Python, SQL, and R  Knowledge of, or willingness and aptitude to learn, healthcare and claims data  Knowledge of building time series, spatial, or financial forecasting models for prediction  Strong mathematical background with strong knowledge in at least one of the following fields: statistics, data mining, machine learning, statistics, operations research, econometrics, natural language processing, and/or information retrieval  Experience in extracting, cleaning, preparing and modeling data  Knowledge of data analytics methodologies, including distribution testing, data cleaning and transformation  Knowledge of data visualizations, including sequence plots, histograms, heat maps, and box plots  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills  Excellent quantitative skills and programming skills  Experience working with large data sets  Experience working with presentation software, such as D3, Tableau, and MS PowerPoint  Demonstrated ability to work independently and in teams  Demonstrated ability to complete work on time Not To Boast, But a Little Bit About UsPayformance Solutions is a health-tech company dedicated to advancing payment transformation in the healthcare industry. We are a wholly owned subsidiary of Altarum Institute, a nonprofit systems research and consulting organization that has been servicing government and private sector clients since 1946.Altarum Institute (Altarum) is a nonprofit organization headquartered in Ann Arbor, Michigan. Altarum serves the public good by solving complex systems problems to improve human health. Altarum creates and implements solutions to advance health among vulnerable and publicly-insured populations. Public sector clients include the U.S. Department of Defense, Department of Health and Human Services, Department of Agriculture, Department of Veterans Affairs, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration, and various state agencies nationwide. Altarum also serves clients in the philanthropic and private sectors. Areas of expertise include health data and analytics; value-based care; public health systems design, development and information exchange; behavioral health and substance use disorders; childhood and adolescent health; medical education; food and nutrition; consumer engagement; elder care; health disparities and equity; and military and veterans’ health.At Payformance, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate, support, and thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our clients, and our community. Payformance Solutions is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Job DescriptionØptimus Consulting, a data science and software company, is seeking a data science fellow in the Washington, DC area. Fellows with the Data Science & Predictive Analytics team will participate in all aspects of work at Øptimus. In an environment where "long-term" projects last one or two weeks, no two days are the same. You'll work on multiple projects: writing call scripts that are used in hundreds of thousands of calls, streamlining our current workflow, sitting in on meetings to offer your valuable insight, and creating statistical models to meet the needs of our clients, just to name a few. A Masters or Doctorate Degree is a plus but not necessary. Must be able to learn quickly and juggle multiple projects with moving deadlines. Must have strong analytical skills. Must have killer Excel skills and be incredibly competent in Word and PowerPoint. Must have experience in R or Python. Experience with Tableau is a plus. A passion or knowledge for politics is preferred but not necessary. Experience with political campaigns, commercial operations, or similar efforts can be very helpful. Experience with computer programming is a plus. CompensationFellows with Øptimus are salaried W2 employees and have benefits, including health insurance, dental and vision insurance, transportation reimbursement, and cell phone reimbursement.CompanyØptimus Consulting is a family of statisticians, graphic designers, data scientists, programmers, social media marketing analysts, and recovering politicos. We boast a two-floor office near the yellow and blue Metro lines, no cubicles, a nacho cheese machine, and kegerator. If you live by the "work hard, play hard" philosophy, then you'll be a great fit with the Øptimus team.vumS6HpHpp

Are you a person who loves data and who wants the opportunity to make a significant contribution and to stretch and grow your skills while working with a group of talented and driven co-workers? The Data Science Specialist will report to the Director of our Digital practice and receive mentoring while working closely with the entire Marketing team.We'd love to talk with you if: • You possess a singular drive to succeed with little supervision, will take pride in helping a company succeed and grow, and will become a valued member of an evolving marketing team• You're the kind of person who steps outside of their list of given assignments to figure out how you can further impact the business.• You love your job and are a fun teammate.Perks of the job are awesome. You'll work with fun people who will be personally invested in the growth of your career. Our job is demanding so a good sense of humor is a huge plus.Specifically, the Data Science Specialist role will be responsible for the following:• Helping identify actionable insights into marketing campaign performance drivers• Building out dynamic dashboards data visualizations for both internal company and client-facing• Building attribution models• Predictive models related to lead outcomes• Assisting to manage and maintain lead database informationQUALITIES & QUALIFICATIONSThe successful candidate will possess the following skills and attributes:• B.S. or B.A. is required. You're excited about this because you know that you're getting twice as much experience as many of your peers.• Drive. Lots of it. You want to run the world one day, and that impresses us. If you're hungry, then this could be the career for you.• Possesses the interpersonal skills needed to work effectively throughout the organization as well as with partners and vendors.• Possesses the energy, ambition, as well as the desire to succeed and learn that are needed in a growing entrepreneurial environment.• Enjoys working hard and having fun, coupled with a good sense of humor.You're probably near the top of the list if you have a few of the following :• 12 + months' online marketing analytics experience in a fast-paced environment• Experience with BI platforms such as Tableau, Data Studio, or others• Experience using R• Experience with SQL databasesMEASURES OF SUCCESSWithin the first twelve months, the Data Science Specialist will have accomplished the following:• Proved to be a valuable addition to the Becker Media team by working effectively internally and externally while delivering a quality product.• Taken ownership of our dynamic dashboards and helped develop additional reporting assets• Be well regarded internally for providing great marketing assistance and a great eye for details, ensuring that reporting and analyses are correct and on point.We look forward to hearing from you!Local Candidates Only

Organization Description AutoGrid?s mission is to organize the exponentially increasing amount of energy data produced from a networked and automated grid and make it useful and actionable for electricity generators and providers, grid operators, and electricity users. With deployments of smart meters, distributed generation, and other building and grid sensing technologies now reaching critical mass, all participants in the electricity supply chain find themselves having to process and analyze thousands of times more data than they?ve had before. Most organizations that produce or consume electricity have yet to take advantage of this information to improve their decision-making processes and lower their costs. AutoGrid enables Utilities, Electricity Service Providers, Grid Operators, DR Aggregators, and End-Users to precisely forecast, monitor and control power consumption securely and in real-time, maximizing the value of existing assets with Software Defined Power Plants. Job Description AutoGrid is seeking Data Science Interns for Summer 2018. We are a rapidly growing company with significant market traction and a large pipeline of diverse opportunities. As such the role will be dynamic and varied, requiring a versatile self-starter willing to dive in to multiple initiatives. Over 10 weeks the intern can expect to become deeply involved in implementing user features and analytics models that will run in production. Our goal is to give the intern exposure to a range of data science techniques and current big data technologies, through the experience of applying them to the energy industry. This role will provide an excellent opportunity to implement features that run in production, at scale. Qualifications Experience in one or more of the following: PythonStream processing frameworksSQLBig Data analyticsAlgorithms in machine learning and econometrics: eg. random forest, SVR, ARIMAExperience in energy and electric utilities is a plus

At Carta, we design products that transform the way hospitals use data to deliver care. We make analyzing data fast, easy, and useful for everyone. We're looking for Data Scientists skilled at rapid iteration and excited about solving problems that can save lives. This is a startup role, where we will ask you to wear many hats and solve many different types of problems.Best of all, when we say Data Science Internship, we mean Data Science internship--no grunt work, no code cleanup, no bug fixes. Like kaggle, you'll be solving incredibly interesting Data Science puzzles but, unlike kaggle, every puzzle you solve will measurably help save people's lives and save our healthcare system. You enjoy building new features and writing elegant code. If this describes you--you belong at Carta.We have open positions in Fall and Winter and we will be reaching out to you in July regarding this role.Excited to talk to you!

Position: Data Scientist Intern – March, 2019, Payformance Solutions (hourly position)  Office: Chicago, IL Why We’re Excited To Get To WorkThe mission for Payformance Solutions is simple. We aim to be a catalyst for payment transformation in the healthcare industry. Our proprietary software solutions allow payers and providers to focus on what really matters: providing patients with access to care that yields the best health outcomes, at the lowest costs.The healthcare industry is complex and fragmented. Payers and providers are faced with a lack of transparency and conflicting financial goals that fail to consider the health outcomes of patients. We help stakeholders plan, negotiate, operate and optimize value-based reimbursement programs by leveraging our industry-leading research and technology to develop alternative payment strategies. This position will help support our data analytics needs. You will be a contributor to the team, tasked with developing analytics models and algorithm solutions.What You ’ Ll Do Assist with data / business analytics needs  Utilize a diverse array of technologies and tools to deliver insights: Python, R, Jupyter, Spark, Hadoop, and AWS Athena  Analyze and model structured data, and implement algorithms to support analysis using advanced statistical and mathematical methods from statistics, machine learning, data mining, econometrics, and operations research  Work with developers and engineers to spec out database models and determine implementation of algorithms  Model building and testing  Perform analysis using big data sources that provide insight and value  Assist in creating reports and provide timely analysis What You’ll Bring To The Table Currently enrolled in a Masters or PhD degree program from an accredited college/ university in quantitative fields (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Data Analytics, or related field)  Proficiency with Python, SQL, and R  Knowledge of, or willingness and aptitude to learn, healthcare and claims data  Knowledge of building time series, spatial, or financial forecasting models for prediction  Strong mathematical background with strong knowledge in at least one of the following fields: statistics, data mining, machine learning, statistics, operations research, econometrics, natural language processing, and/or information retrieval  Experience in extracting, cleaning, preparing and modeling data  Knowledge of data analytics methodologies, including distribution testing, data cleaning and transformation  Knowledge of data visualizations, including sequence plots, histograms, heat maps, and box plots  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills  Excellent quantitative skills and programming skills  Experience working with large data sets  Experience working with presentation software, such as D3, Tableau, and MS PowerPoint  Demonstrated ability to work independently and in teams  Demonstrated ability to complete work on time Not To Boast, But a Little Bit About UsPayformance Solutions is a health-tech company dedicated to advancing payment transformation in the healthcare industry. We are a wholly owned subsidiary of Altarum Institute, a nonprofit systems research and consulting organization that has been servicing government and private sector clients since 1946.Altarum Institute (Altarum) is a nonprofit organization headquartered in Ann Arbor, Michigan. Altarum serves the public good by solving complex systems problems to improve human health. Altarum creates and implements solutions to advance health among vulnerable and publicly-insured populations. Public sector clients include the U.S. Department of Defense, Department of Health and Human Services, Department of Agriculture, Department of Veterans Affairs, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration, and various state agencies nationwide. Altarum also serves clients in the philanthropic and private sectors. Areas of expertise include health data and analytics; value-based care; public health systems design, development and information exchange; behavioral health and substance use disorders; childhood and adolescent health; medical education; food and nutrition; consumer engagement; elder care; health disparities and equity; and military and veterans’ health.At Payformance, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate, support, and thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our clients, and our community. Payformance Solutions is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or disability.To all recruitment agencies: Payformance does not accept agency resumes, we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Job DescriptionØptimus Consulting, a data science and software company, is seeking a data science fellow in the Washington, DC area. Fellows with the Data Science & Predictive Analytics team will participate in all aspects of work at Øptimus. In an environment where "long-term" projects last one or two weeks, no two days are the same. You'll work on multiple projects: writing call scripts that are used in hundreds of thousands of calls, streamlining our current workflow, sitting in on meetings to offer your valuable insight, and creating statistical models to meet the needs of our clients, just to name a few. We'll match what you're good at with what you enjoy and what we need.Fellowships are intended for recent college graduates or those with graduate degrees looking to transition into data science. Having courses or experience in machine learning, data mining, regression, generalized linear models, experimental design, and/or GIS is especially desired. Must have killer Excel skills and be incredibly competent in Word and PowerPoint. Must have experience in R or Python. Experience with Tableau is a plus. A passion or knowledge for politics is preferred but not necessary. Experience with political campaigns, commercial operations, or similar efforts can be very helpful. Experience with computer programming is a plus. CompensationFellows with Øptimus are salaried W2 employees and have benefits, including health insurance, dental and vision insurance, transportation reimbursement, and cell phone reimbursement.CompanyØptimus Consulting is a family of statisticians, graphic designers, data scientists, programmers, social media marketing analysts, and recovering politicos. Shipt is a membership-based marketplace that helps people get the things they need. Job DescriptionØptimus Consulting, a data science and software company, is seeking a data science intern in their Washington D.C. area office for the summer term. Interns with the Data Science & Predictive Analytics team will participate in all aspects of work at Øptimus. In an environment where a "long-term" project lasts one or two weeks, no two days are the same. You won't be getting coffee. You'll sit in on meetings and work on multiple projects: writing call scripts that are used in hundreds of thousands of calls, streamlining our current workflow, and creating statistical models to meet the needs of our clients, just to name a few. You'll be doing the work that a full-time employee does. We'll match what you're good at with what you enjoy and what we need.Our internships are mostly geared towards those still in school, whether undergraduate or graduate. This job posting is for the fall 2019 period, with flexible starting dates between August or September. We don't guarantee full-time employment after an internship, but we're a growing firm and are always looking for bright, hard-working talent. If you're looking for a full-time job, this is a good first step and puts you ahead of the competition!Qualifications Must be able to learn quickly and juggle multiple projects with moving deadlines. Must have strong analytical skills. Must have at least one course in statistics or equivalent real-world experience. Having courses or experience in machine learning, data mining, regression, generalized linear models, experimental design, and/or GIS is especially desired! Must have killer Excel skills and be incredibly competent in Word, PowerPoint, etc. Must have experience in R or Python - both is a plus! A passion for politics is preferred but not necessary. Experience with computer programming is a plus. Experience with statistical modeling is a plus.CompensationInternships with Øptimus are paid commensurate with professional and academic experience.CompanyØptimus Consulting is a family of statisticians, graphic designers, data scientists, programmers, social media marketing analysts, and recovering politicos. Since its founding in 2013, 0ptimus has been at the forefront of developing innovative data and analytics software platforms. 0ptimus has designed and delivered data-driven strategies for leading political campaigns, Fortune 500 companies, and non-profits around the globe.We handle a wide variety of projects and use many different technologies and programs to meet our clients' needs, so our culture here is one of constant learning and curiosity, while doing things the right way. We boast a two-floor office near the yellow and blue Metro lines, no cubicles, a nacho cheese machine, and kegerator. If you live by the "work hard, play hard" philosophy, then you'll be a great fit with the Øptimus team.SDL2019-256
